historySnippet.reasoning: A is already safely above 0.75 and slightly rising, but C is drifting down (dC/dt<0) so I’ll apply a mild “challenge” increase in U while keeping params close to the best record (which already achieved A=1.0 at U=0.10) and avoid risky decay/selection changes given recent mixed impacts from k_D_decay/k_A_decay tweaks.

Agency is already well above the 0.75 threshold and still rising; since the best record occurred at lower U=0.10 and the most recent k_U increase didn’t help, revert U toward the best while keeping parameters stable to preserve the high-A attractor.

Agency is already safely >0.75 and still increasing; since the best record (A=1.0) occurred near U=0.10 with very similar params, I’ll nudge U slightly down toward that optimum while keeping the current high-stimulation coefficients stable to avoid the past k_D_decay/k_A_decay swings that sometimes reduced A.

Agency is already well above the 0.75 target and still rising (dA/dt>0) while complexity is slowly decaying, so I’ll keep U at the best-record level (0.10) and slightly boost complexity retention and diversity-to-complexity transfer to stabilize C without adding extra selection pressure (noting prior U=0.11 reduced A).

Agency is already safely above 0.75 and still rising (dA/dt>0) with U matching the best-record setting, so I’ll take a controlled “challenge” step by nudging U upward while slightly reducing k_A_decay to sustain A (prior U increase helped at Gen 4662.9, whereas larger U=0.11 caused a small dip at Gen 4699.4).

Agency is already very high and still rising; since best record hit A=1.0 at U=0.10 and we’re currently slightly above that (avg U=0.12) with some recent parameter tweaks causing small regressions, revert U toward the best and reduce A decay a notch to lock in and push toward saturation.

Agency is already well above the 0.75 objective and still rising (dA/dt=0.0030) at essentially the best-record U=0.10, so I’ll keep U stable while slightly reducing k_A_decay to sustain near-saturation without destabilizing C/D (recent k_U and k_D_decay tweaks were mixed).

A is already at the ceiling (1.0) but C/D/A are all drifting down, so to stabilize without risking a diversity crash (D is high but dD/dt is strongly negative) I’ll keep U near the best-record 0.10, slightly reduce selection pressure (k_DU) and diversity decay (k_D_decay), and modestly increase diversity growth (k_D_growth) to arrest D collapse while preserving high agency.

A is already >0.75 but slightly fading (dA/dt<0) alongside decaying C, so I’ll revert U toward the best-record 0.10 and apply a minimal stabilizing tweak by lowering k_C_decay (to arrest C loss) and k_A_decay (to sustain A), avoiding disruptive phase-shifts since recent small changes have been mixed.

A is already above the 0.75 objective but is slightly fading while D is collapsing, so I’ll keep U near the proven best (0.10) and reduce diversity-loss terms (k_D_decay, k_DU) to stabilize D without sacrificing the C→A drive that previously produced A≈1.0.

name: Low-U Agency Harvester
description: This agent crossed the threshold by stabilizing agency under a low-difficulty niche (U=0.09) while maintaining very high diversity (0.997) and strong complexity (0.834). Its emergence appears driven by tuning that reduced complexity drag and agency decay (k_C_decay=0.1, k_A_decay=0.001) after repeated sensitivity to difficulty increases (U=0.11 caused an agency drop) and to diversity–difficulty coupling changes (k_DU adjustments repeatedly preceded agency falls).
